```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  warning = FALSE,
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

library(grapher)
library(htmltools)
```


```{r, echo=FALSE}
h1(
  span("{", style = "color:#ffaa0e;"),
  span("grapher"),
  span("}", style = "color:#2ca030;"), 
  class="headline"
)

p(
  style = "text-align:center;",
  tags$a(
    tags$i(class = "fa fa-rocket"),
    "Get Started",
    class = "btn btn-primary",
    href = "articles/get-started.html"
  ),
  tags$a(
    tags$i(class = "fa fa-desktop"),
    "CRAN Dependency Graph",
    class = "btn btn-default",
    target = "_blank",
    href = "https://shiny.john-coene.com/cran"
  )
)

p(
  "Interactive graphs in R, an integration of the many amazing works of",
  tags$a(
    "Andrei Kashcha.", 
    href = "https://github.com/anvaka", 
    target = "_blank"
  )
)

p(
  span("{grapher}", class = "brand"), "lets one visualise large three or two dimensional graphs in RStudio, R markdown, and Shiny.",
  "It supports most graph formats (e.g.: igraph, and gexf). Below is a visualisation of the dependencies between R packages available",
  "on", tags$a("CRAN.", href = "https://cran.r-project.org/", target = "_blank")
)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
tags$a(
  target = "_blank",
  href = "https://shiny.john-coene.com/cran",
  img(
    src = "cran.png",
    class = "img-responsive responsive-img"
  )
)
br()
br()
```

You can get it with the `remotes` or `devtools` package.

```r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("JohnCoene/grapher")
```
